Nitrocellulose is a chemical compound fo: an organic polymer found in cotton fiber and wood, is "nitrated" by exposure to nitric acid or a similar agent. It is explosive and highly flammable, and it is usually dampened with water, alcohol, or other liquid to make it more stable before use.
